Product Name: 100PCS Magnetic Tiles STEM Building Toys Set with 2 Cars, Sensory Stacking Magnetic Blocks for Toddlers & Kids, Ideal for Preschool Montessori Toys Christmas Birthday Gifts for Boys & Girls Ages 3+

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in Australia on 28 August 2024
Reviews.Review Text:
I don't usually write reviews, but this ine deserves one.
Months back i bought a knock off product (from another site), which were smaller tiles, only sides, and one magned per side. Recently my 5 year old started playing with them and really enjoyed it. I thought I'll upgrade, and it was the best decision! Blocks are amazing in a sense theatre you can build on top of each other without them toppling over! We'll, rest is upto your - *cough cough* I mean to your little one's imagination 😉
Oh, it even comes with small balconies for your castle!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 September 2024
Reviews.Review Text: I love how my nephew plays with them for hours and hours. He has built so many things

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 August 2024
Reviews.Review Text: My son loves magnatiles but the packs are so small and pricey. These work the same, and he has so many more to play with! 10/10

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 August 2024
Reviews.Review Text: I and my grandkids have fun building with the tiles. Nice variety of colors and shapes and it helps with creativity for grandson with autism.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 August 2024
Reviews.Review Text: We bought these for my little girl she is only 1 so I just kept out the cars which have the wheels and look to be the only choking hazard. They stick to the door fridge and very well to each other. They are lots of fun even tho she can’t make the cool shapes yet. I would say they are great for kids of all ages.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 August 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Granddaughter loves these very colorful magnetic tiles. At first her buildings were very simple but as time goes by she’s building more sophisticated designs, expanding into multiple layers. It’s very interesting to see the increasing sophistication in her building.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Nice colors, sizes and shapes to work with. First toy kids go to when they come to our home

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 19 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Nice magnetic tiles, but several pieces were broken on opening. 🫤

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Love them. Just as good as the expensive ones. Only con was it came with quite a few no magnetic pieces that snapped into the square magnets. Too many of those but otherwise great.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Magnets a little bit stronger than original. Fun to play

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Need more squares!!!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 July 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Grandchildren love them!!!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 June 2024
Reviews.Review Text: These were a xmas gift for my son, dude could be an architect one day with his imagination and engineering skills with magna tiles. The set came with a little booklet full of ideas for builds, as well as a carrying case, though we don’t use the carrying case since they stay at home anyway. They’re also surprisingly durable for how often they’re dropped and/or accidentally stepped on by the kids.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 June 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Good for hand-eye coordination. The magnets make it easy for a toddler to build things.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 June 2024
Reviews.Review Text: My 3yo kiddo loves his magnet tiles! He builds castles, cubes, ramps, and all kinds of different shapes. He plays with them every single day. They take a pretty good beating and are still on great shape. The colors are bright and they are perfect for working on STEM activities:)

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 June 2024
Reviews.Review Text: True to colors, description and sizes. A much desired addition to any playroom to inspire and develop creativity.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 June 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Purchased as an indoor choice when we can't get outside. My grandson and I have spent hours and hours building and building new. He can easily put them together and build. This set is off great quality and I am really pleased with the number of different shapes.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 May 2024
Reviews.Review Text: They were a hit with my grandson.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 May 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Great magnetic tiles, my 4 y.o. adores playing it, this is our second set. For us it was worth the money

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 April 2024
Reviews.Review Text: After having these tiles for a couple months, these are still his favorite thing to play with. He is super hard on toys (throwing, smashing, chewing) and none of them have broken. We will likely buy more so he can keep building bigger!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 April 2024
Reviews.Review Text: So great - we bought them twice!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 April 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Our grandson loves playing with these, fantastic for a pre-k with a mechanical mind. Hours of interest at a time.

playing

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: The colors are beautiful! I love to put blue and red together to make purple and show my daughter it’s like magic to her lol and fun for me!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Bought a bundle set for my grandson to go with another set he got for Christmas(same brand) and have noticed many edges have cracked or broken off pieces and that unlike his original set these actually repel from each other and do not sit flush when building. I purchased these bundles because it was the same brand and the the original was such a good set. Very disappointed

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: The best brand of magnetic tiles I’ve purchased! My only con is that every package option comes with several tiles we never use. I wish I could just buy more squares at this point. I have purchased 3 packs of Coodoo tiles and we have so many fences(?) and plastic porches(?) that just sit in the bin because we don’t need them. Other than that, the colors are bright and the tiles are VERY durable. EASY CLEAN UP! My kids love them!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Made for a wonderful birthday gift, playing with it everyday

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: These are always a win kids love them

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Our preschool students love these. I had to buy another pack so there is enough to go around.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Both my 7 and 3 year old love these. They work well with another set we already. The magnets are strong but not too strong for the little one to pull apart. I would definitely recommend this set.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 March 2024
Reviews.Review Text: My granddaughter loves her tiles and say she needs more!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 26 February 2024
Reviews.Review Text: My son loves these tiles so much. He loves to tinker and construct things while his baby brother acts as Godzilla and knocks it all over. It's his go to toy and wakes up in the morning saying "build! build!" With how well built these are, I have minimal worries about chocking hazards i.e. the magnets falling out

Reviews.Review Text: Granddaughters loved them. Easy for toddlers to also use. Worth the money

Reviews.Review Text: Got these for my nephew for Xmas and he wanted to build bigger things so got more for his birthday. He loves how sturdy they are when they're built but also how easily they come apart to make new things. He's 4yo

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 February 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Love using these with the kids! Easy for all ages.

Reviews.Review Text: Kids can create so many things. Keeps them happy and busy and encourages creativity

Reviews.Review Text: These tile were great for a 4 year old. He loves them. Constantly build new things. Uses them with other toys like cars and has a blast making tunnels and garages for them 😂

Reviews.Review Text: This product worked well. It matched up and worked well with the other set I have

My 3 year old grand daughter LOVE THEM!!!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 January 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Granddaughter really enjoying her time with this item.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 January 2024
Reviews.Review Text:
I hate when they make these things with weak magnets. This set, however, is pretty strong and can lift 3 or 4 connected pieces. Your creations won't fall apart as easily as other sets I've tried. The other great thing is that the magnets are sealed within the plastic, I don't need to worry about the magnets getting swallowed by the baby!

Comes with a storage bag which is a very welcome addition.

Recommended!

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 January 2024
Reviews.Review Text: Me and my kids absolutely love these magnetic blocks. We play them every day it seems. We plan to get another set or maybe two to be able to make more stuff. They are very fun and can be educational to. I love the little insert pieces to make balconies and stuff if your building the castle. It makes it more immersive for the kids. It's the little things that make their day. These will keep my kids entertained for hours and honestly me and my wife enjoy them as well. They fit together nicely to. Sometimes you have to flip a piece so they magnetize right but that should be expected. If you are considering these for a Christmas or birthday present I would highly recommend them. I would even recommend you get two or three sets to make the fun last even longer. You won't regret buying these. Also the little trains included make it even more immersive for the kids. They love making crazy cars.

Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 January 2024
Reviews.Review Text: My boys (Freshly 2 & almost 4 years old) were absolutely overjoyed to start playing with these tiles. However because they aren't used to building with them, all their builds easily collapse and they get frustrated. My oldest has figured out how to use them after some trial and error but my younger son always has whatever he is building collapse which leads to many tears. So definitely recommend this more for older kids.
